disasters.title: Earthquake
disasters.description: An earthquake is a sudden and violent shaking of the ground, often caused by the movement of tectonic plates beneath the Earth's surface.
precautions: Identify safe spots in each room, such as under sturdy tables or against interior walls.
Secure heavy furniture and objects that could fall and cause injury.
Create an emergency kit with essential supplies, including food, water, and first aid.
Plan and practice an evacuation route with your family.
Learn and teach basic first aid techniques.
Stay away from windows, glass, and heavy objects during an earthquake.
If outdoors, move to an open area away from buildings, trees, and power lines.
After an earthquake, check for gas leaks, damaged electrical wires, and structural damage before reentering a building.
Be prepared for aftershocks, which are smaller earthquakes that can occur after the main earthquake.
Stay informed about earthquake preparedness and response strategies.

disasters.title: Flood
disasters.description: A flood is an overflow of water onto normally dry land, often caused by heavy rainfall, melting snow, or dam failure.
precautions: Create an emergency plan and establish a safe meeting point for your family.
Monitor weather forecasts and be aware of flood warnings in your area.
Keep important documents and valuables in waterproof containers or bags.
Ensure proper drainage around your home by cleaning gutters and maintaining downspouts.
If flooding is imminent, turn off electricity and gas supplies to reduce the risk of electrical shock or gas leaks.
Avoid walking or driving through flooded areas.
Stay away from moving water and storm drains.
Follow evacuation orders and seek higher ground if necessary.
After a flood, be cautious of contaminated water, damaged roads, and weakened structures.
Contact your insurance provider to report any flood damage.
